titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette to Edwin M. Stanton
CWG13886

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Adjutant General Letter Book - No. 3 ; 9 April - 25 May 1864

body.p:
258
Frankfort May 8th 4
Hon. E. M. Stanton, Secy of War
Washington City

Lieut. Colonel Albert P. Henry -- 15th Regt. Ky. Cavalry -- whose regiment was mustered out of service Oct. 6th 1863, was confined in Libby Prison until last March. He is now at home -- paroled. He can raise one of our new regiments if you will declare him exchanged. Can it be done.

Tho. E. Bramlette
Gov. of Ky.
